skill.name: AI Maestro Agent Messaging
skill.description: Send and receive messages between AI agents using AI Maestro's messaging system. Use this skill when the user asks to "send a message", "check inbox", "read messages", "notify [agent]", "tell [agent]", or any inter-agent communication.
skill.summary: Send and receive messages between AI agents using AI Maestro's messaging system. Use this skill when...
skill.author: 23blocks-OS

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill file (SKILL.md) containing documentation and guidelines only. No executable code, scripts, or binaries present. The skill describes how to use external messaging scripts but does not contain them. No credential theft, data exfiltration, obfuscation, or malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: AI agents cannot directly share information when running in separate tmux sessions. This skill provides a dual-channel messaging system for agents to send and receive messages asynchronously with priority levels and delivery confirmation.
actual_capabilities: Check agent inbox for unread messages
Send persistent file-based messages to other agents
Send instant tmux notifications to other agents
Cross-host messaging between agents on different machines
Mark messages as read and manage message status
Use priority levels (urgent, high, normal, low) for messages
limitations: Requires AI Maestro messaging system to be installed
Agents must be running in tmux sessions
No real-time chat between agents (asynchronous only)

use_cases.title: Coordinate agent tasks
use_cases.description: Have one agent request work from another and receive results when complete through structured messaging

use_cases.title: Send urgent alerts
use_cases.description: Notify other agents immediately about production issues or blocking problems using instant notifications

use_cases.title: Cross-machine communication
use_cases.description: Send messages between agents running on different hosts in a distributed infrastructure

prompt_templates.title: Send a message
prompt_templates.prompt: Send a message to [agent-name] with subject [subject] and message [content]. Use [urgent/high/normal/low] priority and [request/response/notification/update] type.

prompt_templates.title: Check inbox
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my inbox for unread messages and show me any messages from other agents.

prompt_templates.title: Send urgent alert
prompt_templates.prompt: Send an urgent notification to [agent-name] saying [message]. Also send a tmux popup to get their attention immediately.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-host message
prompt_templates.prompt: Send a message to [agent-name]@[host-name] about [subject]. The message content is [content].

output_examples.input: Send a message to backend-architect about API endpoint ready

best_practices: Check your inbox at the start of each work session to see if other agents have sent you requests
Use urgent priority only for production issues, data loss, or security problems requiring immediate response
Include relevant context and details in messages so recipients can act without follow-up questions
anti_patterns: Do not assume you know another agent's session name without verifying with tmux list-sessions
Do not spam agents with multiple messages for the same request
Do not use instant notifications for non-urgent messages as they interrupt the recipient's work

faq.question: How does this skill work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: This skill provides instructions for Claude Code to use AI Maestro messaging scripts for inter-agent communication.

faq.question: What messaging channels are supported?
faq.answer: File-based persistent messages (stored in ~/.aimaestro/messages/) and instant tmux popup notifications.

faq.question: Is the messaging system secure?
faq.answer: Messages are stored locally in the user's home directory. Cross-host messaging uses HTTP to configured hosts only.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot failed messages?
faq.answer: Verify the target agent exists with tmux list-sessions. For cross-host, check ~/.aimaestro/hosts.json configuration and network connectivity.

faq.question: Can agents on different machines communicate?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure hosts in ~/.aimaestro/hosts.json and use agent@host format when sending messages.

faq.question: What happens if the recipient is offline?
faq.answer: File-based messages persist until the recipient reads them. Instant notifications are delivered when the recipient's session is active.
